Package controller

Class SlideshowController

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.SlideshowController
  • public class SlideshowController
extends java.lang.Object
    This class takes care of the elements and actions performed on the Slideshow fxml page.
    Author:
    Jahnavi Bavuluri and Chiraag Rekhari

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      int albumIndex
      The index of where the current album is located in the users list of albums.
      javafx.stage.Stage mainStage
      The main stage where the application is running.
      int photo
      The index of the current photo being displayed.
      int userIndex
      The index of where the current user is located in the list of all users.
      java.util.ArrayList<User> UsersList
      The list that stores all the users on the application.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void backToPhotos()
      This method handles the transition back to the photos view.
      void nextPhoto()
      This method shows the next photo in the album as well as displays its caption, date, and tags.
      void previousPhoto()
      This method shows the previous photo in the album as well as displays its caption, date, and tags.
      void start​(javafx.stage.Stage mainStage, int userIndex, int albumIndex)
      This method populates the slideshow view with the first photo in the album and displays the photo's caption, date, and tags.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start​(javafx.stage.Stage mainStage,
                  int userIndex,
                  int albumIndex)
        This method populates the slideshow view with the first photo in the album and displays the photo's caption, date, and tags.
        Parameters:
        mainStage - The main stage where the application is running.
        userIndex - The index of where the current user is located in the list of all users.
        albumIndex - The index of where the current album is located in the users list of albums.
